New Records: Otto López was a triple shy of the cycle; Connor Norby homered and drove in three runs; Xavier Edwards and Nick Fortes had two hits each; John McMillon pitched 1 1/3 scoreless innings; Aaron Nola allowed five runs and nine hits in 4 2/3 innings;
Key Match Events: Bryce Harper hit a tying sacrifice fly; Marlins added four new players with Javier Sanoja making his MLB debut; Marlins worked long counts against Aaron Nola; Connor Norby hit a two-run homer; Marlins scored three runs in the seventh inning;
Pre-Game Insights: Marlins manager Skip Schumaker mentioned the team's resilience and preparation despite a loss the previous day; Marlins added four new players to the roster; Phillies starter Aaron Nola had his shortest start since June;
Post-Match Reflections: Marlins manager Skip Schumaker praised the team's performance; Phillies manager Rob Thomson highlighted Aaron Nola's struggles; Otto López and Jonah Bride contributed with home runs;
Miscellaneous Highlights: Game was played at loanDepot park in Miami, Florida; attendance was 23,189; the line was PHI -250; over/under was 8.5; game time was 2:53; umpires included Chris Segal, Nate Tomlinson, David Rackley, and Larry Vanover
